channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump and Jordan's king meet on Gaza's future. And, U.S. math and reading scores
item.description: Trump and Jordan's King Abdullah will meet to discuss Gaza's future. And, a deep dive into U.S. reading and math scores — and what schools can do abou...

item.title: NTSB investigating deadly crash of plane owned by Mötley Crüe's Vince Neil
item.description: An investigation is underway into Monday's crash of a private jet owned by Mötley Crüe frontman Vince Neil in Scottsdale, Arizona. At least one person...

item.title: Swedish woman convicted of genocide for IS crimes against Yazidis
item.description: Ishaq joined so-called Islamic State in Syria and held nine Yazidi women and children captive as slaves.

item.title: Shopify takes down Ye store selling swastika T-shirts
item.description: Shopify said Yeezy.com violated its policies by selling a shirt promoted by Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, emblazoned with a swastika.

item.title: Top Justice Department official orders prosecutors to drop charges against New York Mayor Eric Adams
Migrants stranded in Mexico try to restart life after Trump eliminates legal pathway to US
item.description: Many migrants have been left stranded in Mexican border cities after the Trump administration immediately canceled tens of thosands of appointments ma...

item.title: Trump says no exemptions with metal tariffs to start in March
item.description: The move threatens to have a big impact in Canada, a major source of the metals in the US.

item.title: John Bolton on expanding into Greenland
item.description: John Bolton, Trump's former national security adviser, says making Greenland an American territory or commonwealth could help with security interests ...

item.title: What are tariffs and why is Trump using them?
item.description: Tariffs are a central part of Trump's political vision, but economists warn they could put prices up.

item.title: Rubiales tells court Hermoso consented to World Cup kiss
item.description: The former Spanish football federation boss gives evidence at his trial on sexual assault and coercion charges.

item.title: Canned tuna sold by major U.S. grocers recalled over botulism concerns
item.description: Certain tuna products may have defective lids that could lead to "a potentially fatal form of food poisoning," FDA notice states.

item.title: Court drops remaining classified documents appeal against Trump's aides
item.description: DOJ had already dropped the case against Trump. Now a federal appeals court has formally dismissed the remainder of that case against Trump's valet Wa...

item.title: Teacher fatally stabs eight-year-old in South Korea
item.description: The country's acting president has ordered an investigation into the incident in the city of Daejeon.

item.title: Why economists got free trade with China so wrong
item.description: The "China Shock" is revisited, and it raises questions about why economists failed to see the costs of free trade.

item.title: Vance warns EU against AI overregulation at summit in Paris
item.description: In his first international address, Vice President JD Vance also argued AI must remain free from "ideological bias."

item.title: Villagers offer support for a critical lifeline in rural Alaska days after plane crash kills 10

item.description: High-profile burglaries of pro athletes are seen as part of a wider pattern of criminals traveling from South America to target affluent homes in the ...

item.title: Is it risky to open a CD with an online bank? What experts say
item.description: Online banks may offer better rates, but there are some potential drawbacks to take into account, too.
